EngPost_DB.content: When the era really kicks in,Only a few are pushing back.When the era flows by,Everybody just rides the wave and the boat.Thank you.With a broken heart, of course.AMON.It is important time for everyone to be free from the military dictatorship.

EngPost_DB.title: Holding  Remembrance Activity  By Wearing Shirts Attached With Pictures of The  First (4) Fallen Heroes in Yangon During Spring Revolution
EngPost_DB.content: Comrades from Yangon Revolution Force , YRF's Soft Strike Community carried out remembrance activity at some places in Yangon, including the places where the  first (4) heroes have fallen during the Spring Revolution.Mg Zin Lin Htet (20 years old), Daw Tin Nwe Yi (59 years old), Ko Hein Htut  Aung (23 years old) and Ko Nyi Nyi Aung Htet  Naing (23 years old) were brutally killed and cracked down by the military council soldiers in Yangon.At this time in 2021, we were full of courage, great  vigor and we felt resentment. We had strong convictions that we must defeat the terrorist military council. We must fight against the military council at all cost for our fallen heroes of revolution. Therefore, we would like to once again urge the general public to involve and strengthen our spring  revolution.Uprising must succeed.Soft Strike Community.Yangon Revolution Force - YRF

EngPost_DB.title: NLD Minister, Thura U Oo Aung Ko, who was imprisoned for 12 years, was released.
EngPost_DB.content: NLD Minister, Thura U Oo Aung Ko, who was imprisoned for 12 years, was released last night.It is reported that the NLD Government's Union Minister, Thura U Aung Ko, was released by the terrorist SAC last night on 3 January.U Tun Kyi, a member of Steering Committee of the former Political Prisoners' Association, said that ‚Äúthe NLD government's Minister of the Ministry of Religious Affairs,Tura U Aung Ko, was sentenced to 12 years in prison and was released by the SAC without any announcement.News Source:Myanmar Pressphoto Agency Facebook

EngPost_DB.title: Pope Francis said on Myanmar Crisis
EngPost_DB.content: Although the Pope Francis has not forgotten to speak about the Myanmar affairs, the Myanmar venerable monks are keeping their mouths shut.‚ÄúThe Pope Francis brought up and spoke Myanmar affairs on Christmas Day, but the venerable monks of Myanmar pretended that they do not know about Myanmar affairs and Myanmar people who are killed and violented by the SAC and they are keeping their mouths shut,‚Äù a Yangon-based political analyst said.On 25 December, the Pope Francis spoke that at the Christmas Day ceremony held at St. Peter‚Äôs Cathedral, ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs be last peace in Yemen‚Äù, and ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs end to the bloodshed and shine a light on reconciliation in Myanmar and in Iran,‚Äù VOA reported.The Pope Francis spoke about the Myanmar people who are being killed and tortured by the SAC from time to time. He does not forget to speak about Myanmar issue. Our Myanmar venerable monks act like they don't have anything to do with the Spring Revolution and they do not speak anything that the Myanmar people are being killed and violented by the SAC. It is very sad,he said.Source:Myanmar Pressphoto Agency,Photo:Pope Francis (Vatican News)
